meanings.definition: Very fine or extremely small in size or texture.
meanings.sent1: The artist used a microfine brush to paint the tiny details.
meanings.sent2: The microfine sand felt smooth between my fingers.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled the microfine glitter all over the table, creating a sparkling mess.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was so microfine that she noticed the tiniest imperfections.
meanings.sent5: The microfine powder created a cloud of dust when she blew on it.

meanings.definition: To make something very fine or extremely small in size or texture.
meanings.sent1: She carefully microfined the ingredients to create a smooth paste.
meanings.sent2: The machine can microfine metal into a powder for industrial use.
meanings.sent3: He tried to microfine the sugar, but ended up with a cloud of sweetness in the air.
meanings.sent4: The chef's skillful hands could microfine herbs with precision.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a special tool to microfine the edges of the sculpture.
